org.modelio.api.module.commands

Class ApplyPatternStandardHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.modelio.api.module.commands.DefaultModuleCommandHandler
      • org.modelio.api.module.commands.ApplyPatternStandardHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IModuleCommandHandler

    public class ApplyPatternStandardHandler
extends DefaultModuleCommandHandler
    Command handler to apply a pattern.

    Registered as default command handler for "PatternApply" module command verb.

    The run pattern will have access to the following parameters:

    • The pattern name : the selected element
    • "selection" : the selected element
    • "selectionName" : the selected element name
    • "module" : the current module
    Used handler parameters:
    • "pattern_name" : the pattern name. Used to set a pattern parameter with the pattern name as key and the Modelio selected element as value
    • "pattern_path" : the pattern file path relative to the module resources directory.
    Since:
    Modelio 3.4

    • Method Detail

      • actionPerformed

        public void actionPerformed(List<MObject> selectedElements,
                            IModule module)
        Description copied from interface: IModuleCommandHandler
        Method invoked when the command is launched.

        This command is launched by Modelio when the user clicks on the contextual menu command. The selected elements that corresponds to the current selection are given as parameter.

        The module that is passed as parameter corresponds to the owner of the command.

        Parameters:
        selectedElements - Current selection
        module - Owner of the command

      • configure

        protected Map<String,Object> configure(List<MObject> selectedElements,
                                       IModule module)
        Configure the command before being executed.

        This method is a hook called by actionPerformed(List, IModule). It returns the parameters the pattern will use.

        By default copy all the command handler parameters and add the following ones:

        • selection : the selectedElements selection
        • module : the IModule.
        Parameters:
        selectedElements - the current selection in Modelio
        module - the module owning the command handler.
        Returns:

      • postConfigure

        protected void postConfigure(List<MObject> selectedElements,
                             IModule module)
        Hook called once the pattern is applied and before the transaction is committed.

        Does nothing by default. Sub classes may redefine this method to make additional modifications.

        Parameters:
        selectedElements - the current selection in Modelio
        module - the module owning the command handler.

      • accept

        public boolean accept(List<MObject> selectedElements,
                      IModule module)
        Description copied from class: DefaultModuleCommandHandler
        The handler accepts elements matching the scopes
        Specified by:
        accept in interface IModuleCommandHandler
        Overrides:
        accept in class DefaultModuleCommandHandler
        Parameters:
        selectedElements - Current selection
        module - Owner of the command
        Returns:
        true if the command is valid for all the elements, false otherwise.
